name: Broccoli Wings
description: These broccoli wings are out of this world! They're easy to make, super crispy, and spicy. They're great with a bowl of brown rice or as an appetizer.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk
1/2 - 1  cup homemade or store-bought gochujang sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully cut the broccoli into bite-sized florets.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully cut the broccoli into bite-sized florets.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the garlic power, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.  Stir until well combined. For a gluten-free version substitute the all-purpose flour with chickpea flour (also omit the water if using chickpea flour).
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the garlic power, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.  Stir until well combined. For a gluten-free version substitute the all-purpose flour with chickpea flour (also omit the water if using chickpea flour).

recipeInstructions.text: Dip the broccoli florets into the batter, so they’re completely coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip the broccoli florets into the batter, so they’re completely coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll them in the panko breadcrumbs. Omit this step for a gluten-free version. However, they’re way crispier with the panko breadcrumb coating.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll them in the panko breadcrumbs. Omit this step for a gluten-free version. However, they’re way crispier with the panko breadcrumb coating.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the broccoli florets on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the broccoli florets on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the baked broccoli wings to a bowl. Either combine all of the ingredients for the gochujang sauce in a small bowl or use store-bought gochujang sauce. Pour it over the baked broccoli wings. Evenly coat them from all sides by stirring them a few times.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the baked broccoli wings to a bowl. Either combine all of the ingredients for the gochujang sauce in a small bowl or use store-bought gochujang sauce. Pour it over the baked broccoli wings. Evenly coat them from all sides by stirring them a few times.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the coated broccoli back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the coated broccoli back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and sprinkle with the green onions and sesame seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately and sprinkle with the green onions and sesame seeds.
